newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-LATE SHEARER GOAL GIVES ENGLAND VICTORY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-LATE SHEARER GOAL GIVES ENGLAND VICTORY.

text.p: England defeated France 1-0 in a fiercely-contested Tournoi de France match on Saturday when Alan Shearer pounced on a rare mistake by French goalkeeper Fabien Barthez.
It was Shearer's 11th goal in his last 11 internationals and sealed England's sixth successive win and their first in France for 48 years.
The goal in the 85th minute came when Teddy Sheringham, who had only replaced Ian Wright five minutes earlier, sent a low ball into the French six-yard box.
Barthez -- who had denied England with four outstanding saves -- failed to keep hold of the ball and it ran loose to Shearer who made no mistake from only a few metres out.

The win left England top of the four-team tournament with six points following their 2-0 win over Italy on Wednesday and sent France to only their second defeat in 36 matches under coach Aime Jacquet.
The Tournoi continues on Sunday when world champions Brazil meet Italy in Lyon.
